description: Dive into "Patong's Shopping Paradise: Malls to Explore" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Patong's Shopping Paradise: Malls to Explore

places.generalDescription: Central Phuket Festival is a massive multi-level shopping mall located just outside Phuket Town. It boasts over 120 outlets, offering a wide range of products and services to cater to every shopper's needs. The mall features international brands, boutique stores, apparel shops, and more. Additionally, visitors can enjoy the first-class cinema experience at SFX, which showcases Hollywood blockbusters, Thai releases, and Bollywood films with modern digital sound technology and VIP seating options.

sources.snippet: Central Festival is a massive multi-level shopping mall, sprawling just outside Phuket Town. The complex has over 120 outlets, catering to every customer service imaginable and making it the dream destination for shopping in Phuket. There are many international brands, boutique stores, and apparel shops which are up-to-date on everything from cloth (Read More)ing, silk products, raw cloth, bedding, and household goods, to children's toys.

Central Phuket stands as a colossal mall, a true haven for avid shoppers. Here, you‚Äôll find an extensive range of both international and local brands, creating an absolute paradise for those seeking retail therapy. Whether you‚Äôre into fashion or electronics, Central Phuket has it all conveniently housed under one expansive roof.
sources.shortName: Phuket‚Äôs 13 Best Shopping Malls We Keep Coming Back To [2025 ]

places.name: Central Phuket

reviews.text:
Central Phuket Festival has evolved from the original Central Festival Phuket, which opened in 2004, into a larger complex that includes Central Floresta.

The expansion, which began in 2013 and resumed in 2016, added a new luxury wing, Central Floresta, and connected it to the existing Central Festival building via a bridge. Central Phuket aims to provide a world-class shopping and entertainment experience, integrating local culture with global trends.

Here's a more detailed look at the history:

Central Festival Phuket (Original):
Opened in 2004, it was a significant retail and entertainment destination in Phuket.

Expansion Plans:
In 2013, plans were announced to expand the complex, but construction was delayed.

Resumption of Construction:
Construction resumed in 2016, with the goal of creating a larger, more luxurious shopping and entertainment complex.

Central Floresta:
The new wing, Central Floresta, was designed to connect with the existing Central Festival building, creating a larger, unified space.

Concept:
Central Phuket aims to offer a "World Comes to Play" experience, combining premium shopping, entertainment, and attractions.

Luxury Focus:
Central Floresta is positioned as a more luxurious space, catering to a clientele seeking leading brands and world-class experiences.

Integration of Culture and Trends:
Central Phuket plays a role in integrating local traditions with global trends, reflecting Phuket's development as a sought-after international destination.

During my visit to Thailand in 2022, I stayed at a hotel across the street and visited this mall frequently. It reminded me of home but with its own Thai twist. It isn't any average mall! They've got a movie theatre, aquarium, among many other things. There is lots of shops, both high end and affordable options. I especially love their food court which is presented as a street market.

Super big Shopping Mall. I love the luxury vibe and the safety. The grocery store is the best, we have seen in Phuket so far. Fantastic, fresh fruits. Very nice vibe, especially with the beautiful fish pond inside. Super Relaxing.

places.generalDescription: Central Phuket Floresta is a modern and bustling multi-level mall that offers a wide variety of retailers and a food court. It is an expansive extension of the popular Central Festival, designed to address the growing population and alleviate overcrowding at the original location. The mall caters more to locals than tourists due to its location on the outskirts of Phuket town.

sources.snippet: Central Floresta, Central Festival, Jungceylon and Central Patong are among the largest malls on the island and have taken shopping and entertainment in Phuket to a whole new level. These shopping complexes feature a plethora of shops, restaurants, as well as cinemas and other entertainment. On a smaller scale are Robinson Department Store, Limelight Phuket and Boat Avenue.
sources.shortName: Department Stores & Shopping Malls Phuket - Shopping

places.name: Central Phuket

reviews.text: Super big Shopping Mall. I love the luxury vibe and the safety. The grocery store is the best, we have seen in Phuket so far. Fantastic, fresh fruits. Very nice vibe, especially with the beautiful fish pond inside. Super Relaxing.

We enjoyed our two trips here, I got my nails done at Sparkle they were great. We went in the M&S for some homely treats that we have been missing. The have two parts to the mall, high end luxury shops and then your more normal end shops. It was great there was a Sephora and Zara, as I use these often at home. Will be back again for some more shopping.

During my visit to Thailand in 2022, I stayed at a hotel across the street and visited this mall frequently. It reminded me of home but with its own Thai twist. It isn't any average mall! They've got a movie theatre, aquarium, among many other things. There is lots of shops, both high end and affordable options. I especially love their food court which is presented as a street market.

places.generalDescription: Bangla Night Market, located on Bangla Road in Phuket, is a vibrant and bustling night market that offers an array of experiences for visitors. The market is known for its lively atmosphere and caters to those looking to indulge in food, drinks, and entertainment. Visitors can explore numerous stalls and street food shops offering freshly prepared meats, seafood, Thai desserts, and a variety of culinary delights.

sources.snippet: Bangla Market, nestled at the end of Bangla Road in Patong Beach, is a vibrant hub renowned for its lively atmosphere and a mix of market and an open-air food court featuring an array of shops, street food and entertainment options. Visitors can explore an eclectic mix of local handicrafts, clothing, and souvenirs while indulging in delicious street food. As the sun sets, Bangla Market transforms into a dynamic nightlife destination with bustling bars and clubs, making it a must-visit for those seeking a lively and unforgettable experience in Patong Beach.

places.name: Bangla Night Market

reviews.text:
The night market is pretty awesome! It is a massive maze of food and shops. Pricing is great and its covered as well as can be. Consider it a large flea market if you're from the states.

It is hot so bring your fan and a towel if you're a sweater like me. If you're a germaphobe bring hand sanitizer.

You can haggle on prices here so give them your best offer before you settle on souvenir prices but don't cheat them. They are trying to make some money after all.

I'm delighted to share my great experience at Bangla Night Market
on this Sunday, during my stay at
Patong.
One must go as there are lots of
bars,live music,dancing,live bands
shopping & food stalls.
The food street is full of fresh food
stalls with fresh fish,lobsters,crabs
prawns-you get food of your taste.
Shopping stalls selling lot of items
including artificial jewellery etc,but
one has to negotiate the rates.
In my view, one must go there at
least once to earn the experience
of nightlife of Patong ,while you
are in Phuket.üëçüëç

Pretty good fresh sea food one can get in here but be careful because they're cheating with the scales and charge more than they should. We checked a few places before we decided where to eat. For example we told one guy to measure two of the big tiger prawns and they we half a kg on his scale. Went to another picked two smaller tiger prawns and it showed 600kg on his scale.... so yeah watch out. We've chosen yummy yummy and it was very yummy :)) fried rice with vegetables, one octopus skewer and two huge tiger prawns with garlic butter sauce, it was cooked to perfection and just enough for two people. And all together our dinner was half as cheap if went to a restaurant so didn't regret it and will go back again. 4 stars only because some of them are cheating. 5 stars for food

places.address: DTambon Patong, Kathu District, Phuket 83150, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Central Patong is a bustling and upscale shopping destination in Phuket, offering a modern space with familiar apparel and cosmetics brands, as well as a variety of dining options. It provides an escape from the heat with its sophisticated shopping experience, numerous restaurants, and activities. Located near the vibrant Patong Beach and the lively Bangla Road, it serves as the epicenter of nightlife on the island.

sources.snippet: Central Patong is a shopping mall in the heart of Patong, accessible from the famous Bangla Road and just opposite of the famous Jungceylon. This recent mall offers an extensive selection of shops, ranging from fashion and accessories to electronics and cosmetics. With its modern architecture and spacious interiors, Central Patong provides a comfortable and convenient shopping experience.

Central Patong is located in the heart of Patong Beach, on Rat U-Thit 200 Pee Road opposite the large Jungceylon shopping mall. Patong Central offer a large variety of outlets with many internationally renowned clothing brands on different floors. While the underground floor is exclusively used for selling food in a welcoming and modern ambience.
The mall is also home to several department stores, including Robinson and Central, which provide a one-stop shopping experience for visitors looking for variety and convenience.

places.name: Central Patong

reviews.text: Great food court with plenty of options. We loved it most because of the air conditioning, it made our dinners more comfortable. Highly recommended.

If you're in Patong, this place is a must-visit! Just a short walk from Patong Beach and conveniently located next to Bangla Road and opposite of Jungceylon Mal, it offers a mix of shopping and souvenir options. The ground floor is especially worth exploring for its variety of delicious food choices.

Basement (B1): Features a high-end Tops supermarket and a food court offering Thai, Indian, Japanese, and Western dishes at reasonable prices. Ôøº
‚Ä¢	Ground Floor: Houses cosmetics, sunglasses, accessories, and kiosks with souvenirs. Popular caf√© ‚ÄúAfter You‚Äù is a top dessert spot. Ôøº
‚Ä¢	Second Floor: Clothing brands include H&M, Uniqlo, Adidas, Thai brands like NaRaYa, Jaspal, and Greyhound. Ôøº
‚Ä¢	Third Floor: Sportswear, electronics, toys, luggage, and more lifestyle goods.

places.address: 198, 9 Soi Rat Uthit 200 Pi 1, Pa Tong, Kathu District, Phuket 83150, Thailand

sources.snippet: While strolling across the Jungceylon Mall, you cannot igno (Read More)re noticing two of its largest stores ‚Äì Robinson and the Big C Supermarket.

places.name: Big C
places.address: Tambon Wichit, Amphoe Mueang Phuket, Chang Wat Phuket 83000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Patong Beach, Jungceylon is a sprawling shopping paradise that promises an unforgettable experience for every visitor. This expansive mall features a diverse array of specialty shops and casual dining options, making it the perfect spot to unwind after a day in the sun. From trendy clothing and stylish accessories to unique souvenirs and spa products, Jungceylon has something for everyone.

sources.snippet: One of the most popular and appealing shopping centres in Phuket, Jungceylon Shopping Mall is home to countless amazing stores and parlours selling beautiful clothes, shoes, bags, jewellery, and other accessories, as well as spa products, souvenirs, toys, electronics and other goods. Basically, whatever you‚Äôre looking for, chances are you‚Äôll find it at Jungceylon. There is also a supermarket on the ground floor, offering a wide selection of groceries, fresh fruit and vegetables, spirits, cosmetics and more.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Places for Shopping in Patong

sources.snippet: Jungceylon Shopping Mall, located in the heart of Patong Beach in Phuket, Thailand, is a bustling retail and entertainment hub that caters to both locals and tourists. Opened in 2006, it is one of the largest shopping centers in Phuket, covering an impressive area of over 200,000 square meters. The mall's design reflects a blend of modern and traditional Thai architecture, featuring a spacious and airy layout that enhances the shopping experience.

Jungceylon is the name used for Phuket Island over a hundred years ago. The island was known for its wealth from international trade and its wealth of natural beauty. Now the name ‚ÄúJungceylon‚Äù has become the name of the largest and most stylish shopping center in the southern part of Thailand, covering an area of 200,000 square meters in the center of tourism and business in Patong, Phuket.
sources.shortName: Local Patong Attractions - Beaches, Shopping, and Gems

sources.snippet: Considered one of the most popular shopping spots in Patong, Jungceylon is home to many shops selling clothes, electronics, toys and more. Whatever you are looking for, whether it‚Äôs branded goods to souvenirs to take home from your trip, Jungceylon is bound to have it. This air-conditioned shopping mall also offers many activities for your little ones including a cinema.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Shopping Spots in Patong Beach

sources.snippet: There is the most intensive flow of people and more than 200 shops do business. You can find more than 200 stores offering a shopping heaven in Phuket, items including brand-name clothes, sunglasses, cosmetics and perfumes, shoes, computer games, DVD, tons of mobile phones and electrical goods. It's a nice place to hang out and do some shopping, as well as sight seeing.

Jungceylon Shopping Center is a massive complex in the very centre of Patong Beach and the largest on Phuket Island. Covering 200,000 square meters, it‚Äôs so vast it feels like a city within a city. Jungceylon shopping centre offers a diverse range of shopping, dining, and entertainment options.

Jungceylon Shopping Mall Phuket is the largest mall in the center of Patong Beach and one of the biggest mall in Phuket. Jungceylon is considered one of Phuket‚Äôs best malls with over 300 shops. Ranging from fashion and leisure brands to restaurant and lifestyle products.

Jungceylon is the biggest Shopping and Lifestyle Center in Southern Thailand located in Rat-U-Thit Road in Patong and is just 5 minutes away from the beach. This shopping center is a place not only for shopping but also for drinking, dining, entertainment and leisure.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Patong beach, Phuket Thailand

sources.snippet: More than its beach waters, Thailand‚Äôs premiere beach destination is known for its shopping extravaganza. In fact, the island plays home to some of the biggest malls in the country ‚Äì the most famous of which is Jungceylon Phuket.
sources.siteName: Phuket Travel Guide | Discover the best things to do in Phuket

places.name: Jungceylon

reviews.text: Plenty of shopping, restaurants & things to di in the area! A store for anything & everything you're looking for & food for what ever you ha e an appetite for. Busy area but a great vibe & great atmosphere. You will need all day so don't go if you don't have the time. Get a taxi there because I saw nowhere to park when our driver dropped us off.

The best mall I've ever been to! A huge variety of different stores for all your needs. You can get souvenirs here or even watch a movie. There is also a whole lot of restaurants and food stores.

Since it's Pride month, everything is decorated and looks really cute ü•∞

Nice mall full of local and global brands of all sorts and many restaurants and dessert shops. The mall is split into many sections each with a different name e.g. The Jungle.

Located behind the Bangla walking street.

sources.snippet: Street shopping offers an enjoyable and convenient experience, often filled with entertainment as you explore. People typically visit without specific shopping intentions but rather get drawn to items they hadn‚Äôt considered before, adding to the fun of purchasing. Prices initially quoted are higher than expected, necessitating bargaining.

sources.shortName: Shopping in Patong beach, Phuket Thailand

places.name: Patong Shopping Center

reviews.text: Lots of nice food as well as friendly people, places to sit and eat your food also
Good shopping center, have cinema, supermarket, some cafes and lots pf shops! Tidy and nice!
Souvenir in patong and thai snacks

places.address: 142 Thawewong Rd, Kathu, Kathu District, Phuket 83150, Thailand

sources.shortName: Jungceylon Shopping Mall In Patong: Best Guide For Shopping

places.name: Love Eat Jungceylon

reviews.text: Love Eat Jungceylon offers a delightful culinary experience within the Jungceylon Shopping Centre. The expansive and thoughtfully designed food court houses a diverse range of local, Asian, and Western cuisines, making it a haven for food enthusiasts. The variety of reasonably priced dishes ensures there's something for every palate. The clean and ample seating, coupled with efficient payment through Jungceylon's internal card system, adds convenience to the dining experience. Purchasing the card at the food court is a seamless process. Additionally, the availability of refreshing beverages, including Thai tea and fruit juices, enhances the overall appeal. For a satisfying and diverse dining adventure, Love Eat Jungceylon is a must-visit destination.

Very limited variety of food and not that many stalls especially if you are comparing the size of the mall to the size of the food court.  Nothing like the food courts in MBK, CentralWorld, Terminal 21 etc.  I found the food to be quite average tasting here and portion size small (majority of items around the 150bht price range). I'd definitely recommend venturing out of Jungceylon mall to eat. Many different restaurants along the main strip that would be better value and quality.  Plenty of seating though which is well maintained.
Order your food from different stalls . They give you a ticket , you then pay at the cashier . You then receive a number , pick your food up when it's done . Simples ‚Ä¶  Nice food

places.address: V7RX+9PV, Pa Tong, Kathu District, Phuket 83150, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Index Living Mall Phuket is a must-visit destination for friends and family in Thailand. The mall offers a wide range of products, from top-notch theater systems, artworks, bedding, and kitchenware to high-quality clothing brands and delectable cuisines at its restaurants. Located on Chalermprakiat Road near Big C, the top floor houses an Index furniture store with mass-produced furniture.

sources.snippet: Customize your furniture at Phuket‚Äôs largest furniture mall, the Index Living Mall boasting the latest global home improvement trends. The first floor is dedicated to shops selling goods, the Oishi Japanese Buffet Restaurant, a mini coffee shop, and kitchenware stores. On the second floor are designer outlets such as Berlin Urbanloft.

sources.shortName: Phuket‚Äôs 13 Best Shopping Malls We Keep Coming Back To [2025 ]

places.name: Index Living Mall Phuket

reviews.text: Great service with khun Beer very diligent & so patient. Her colleagues with her were all so friendly & helpful...always gracious & smiling. Been shopping for 2 over years here with great joy & pleasure as usual. Thank you for the dessert!

I've been shopping here for a while, and while they have some nice items, the prices are consistently high, and the customer service is terrible. The staff gives conflicting information about discounts, and no one seems to know anything when you ask for help. Very frustrating experience-definitely not worth the hassle.

Please don't buy here. I bought a desktop chair in this shop, they didn't have in stock. I received my order and the welding of chair was not ok, I couldn't setup the chair.

I go to the shop but told me "We only sell, we don't have after-sales service. They told me that some service in bangkok will call me but they didn't. I come back with my thai friend to know what do, they try to acting to do something to finally say "Wait for customer service call you back, we only seller..."

One week I have this chair in my living room and nobody care.

They really nice to sell, but after that they make all their possible to not help you.

The most funny is when you go in shop, have 5 people to sell for only one small section, everyone in their phone, nobody help you.

100% better to go Index just in front of Square index. When I had trouble they help for for the after-service.

Square index only sell, take their commision and doesn't care of you after that.

Use Shopee or another shop instead.

sources.snippet: The mall is also home to several department stores, including Robinson and Central, which provide a one-stop shopping experience for visitors looking for variety and convenience.

places.name: Robinson Jungceylon

reviews.text: My visit to Robinson in Jungceylon Shopping Centre Phuket was a delightful experience. The store boasts a spacious and well-organized layout, making it easy to navigate through its extensive selection of imported and local products. It's a hotspot for tourists seeking quality items, from clothing and accessories to bags and beyond. The attentive, friendly, and helpful service enhanced my shopping journey, leaving a positive impression. I left tempted to return, confident in Robinson's ability to consistently deliver an enjoyable shopping experience.

Located within The Botanica, this spot is perfect for tourists seeking higher quality options compared to the local markets. Plus, you can conveniently claim a tax refund directly on your purchases, making it an even more attractive destination.
The only downside is that the prices are on the higher side.

The only downside is that the prices are on the higher side.

Bought some Nike flip flops here 6 days ago, they literally fell apart 2 days after I bought them. Came back to the shop and some assistant makes up some bullshit excuse about not going on the beach with them to stop them from falling apart. I didn't go on the beach with them, I just used them walking around the streets. Wouldn't be m surprised if the shoes are all fake. Basically the foot cover were superglued to the sides. Don't shop at the shoe section. No replacement was offered and service was in broken English. Nonsense
